title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 23 February - BBC News
summary: men charged over b & q knife attack .
man guilty of attacking girlfriend before death .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has ended for today but some breaking news , sport and travel will continue to appear through the night .
we will be back again tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with clear spells
text: areas of cloud through tonight , especially at first but there will be some clear spells too .
rather cold with the risk of a frost developing locally .
a fine day to come on saturday with plenty of sunshine throughout the day .
it will be cold though , especially in the moderate easterly breeze .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: man slashes throat in court dock
text: a criminal slashed his throat with a razorblade in the dock at leicester crown court after being convicted of sexually abusing his six-year-old daughter .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: cctv of 'murdered ' teen 's last moments
text: police have released a cctv image of a 17-year-old boy captured shortly before he was killed .
lyrico steede died in hospital from stab wounds after he was chased and attacked by a group in bulwell .
nottinghamshire police said he had been riding the tram to bulwell before he died .
he had been wearing a black puma hooded jacket and dark trousers .
he was chased along lillington road after he was attacked in hempshill lane recreation ground , known as nelson park , despite being injured before being left seriously hurt in stock well .
the teenager died on monday , almost a week after the attack on 13 february .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: medical emergency aboard east midlands flight
text: a passenger has become unwell on board a flight from the canary islands to east midlands airport .
an airport spokesman said , despite the medical emergency , the ryanair flight from las palmas in gran canaria will land at east midlands as scheduled .
ryanair # fr3163 to ema is declaring an emergency # radarbox
what happened ?
it 's a medical emergency
they did n't sell any perfume .
hoffentlich geht alles gut
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: man caught by paedophile hunters jailed
text: a man , who was caught in a paedophile hunters sting , has been jailed for meeting underage girls for sex .
michael kinnear , from beeston , persistently contacted girls on facbeook and tried to meet them for sex , nottinghamshire police said .
a group called totnes justice said it caught the 28-year-old in a cctv sting , grooming girls he thought were young but were in fact decoys .
kinnear invited girls aged between 12 and 15 to parties at his house , plied them with alcohol and pretended to be a 16-year-old .
he gave others cigarettes and gifts and asked them to meet him for sex .
at nottingham crown court today , he admitted eight child sex offences , including sexual activity with a child , and was sentenced to three years and nine months in prison .
he was also sentenced for sexual assault on a vulnerable adult in derbyshire and made to sign the sex offenders ' register for life .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: 'no alcohol smell ' on m1 death crash man
text: 'no alcohol smell ' on m1 death crash man

documents.title: care worker admits defrauding residents
text: care worker admits defrauding residents

documents.title: cricket : hales bidding for caribbean t20 stint
text: alex hales has put himself forward for next month 's caribbean premier league ( cpl ) auction .
the 29-year-old signed a new limited-overs deal with nottinghamshire earlier this week , effectively freeing him up for more global t20 contracts .
the 2018 cpl runs between 8 august-16 september .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: breakingboy who died in hospital 'abandoned ' in a & e - coroner
text: a coroner has recorded that a three-year-old boy with down 's syndrome who was left for hours in a & e instead of being moved quickly to a specialist unit , died of natural causes .
however she was highly critical of the care krishan saujani received at leicester royal infirmary .
for 12 hours his critical condition was not recognised .
lydia brown said : i agree with the family 's view that krishan was 'abandoned ' in a & e .
`` there were many delays in investigating his condition .
there was a total lack of co-ordination by staff . ''
krishan died from bronchial pneumonia at the hospital on 8 november 2015 .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: foxes to outline vision for training ground
text: early plans for leicester city 's new training ground will go on show to fans before the club 's game with bournemouth next month .
the foxes announced earlier this month their intention to relocate training facilities to land previously owned by a golf club near seagrave .
representatives from the club , project managers deloitte and architects kss design group will be outside the club shop between 10:00-15:00 on 3 march .
they will be hosting an exhibition and discussion of `` site plans and strategy '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: work to install eco-friendly lights almost done
text: a scheme to upgrade leicestershire street lights and improve their efficiency is `` almost complete , '' according to the county council .
the authority said `` around 99 % '' of low and high level street lights had been changed as part of a £ 25m investment .
work as part of the project has included installing led bulbs and removing unnecessary highway sign lighting .
county councillor blake pain said : `` i am delighted to see that the led scheme is almost complete .
`` the new lighting enables us to be more flexible in how we manage lighting and helps make the county look more modern as well as being more energy efficient . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: praise for city 's global investment strategy
text: a new report has praised the way derby has attracted foreign investment .
the report in fdi magazine , a division of the financial times , placed derby top in the uk 's small cities category .
martin rawson , deputy leader of the city council , said : `` this recognition is wonderful and showcases derby as a truly global business city . ''
derby is home to big international companies such as rolls-royce , toyota and bombardier .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: ex-tory mp lands university job
text: ex-mp neil carmichael , who suffered a `` shock '' loss at last year 's general election , has taken up a job at the university of nottingham .
mr carmichael , who was mp for stroud , in gloucestershire , between 2010-17 , is to become an honorary professor in the schools of education and politics and international relations .
he also served as chair of the education select committee during his time in parliament .
the former conservative mp said he was `` delighted '' with his new role and he already has `` several key projects under way '' .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man charged with kidnapping woman for sex assault
text: a man has been charged with kidnapping a 39-year-old woman for purpose of sexual assault and robbery .
police were called to churchgate in retford at about 06:30 yesterday to a report a woman had been assaulted .
a 20-year-old man , from retford , was arrested , charged and has been remanded in custody to appear at nottingham crown court next month .
the woman suffered facial injuries and was taken to hospital .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: m1 crash driver 'twice drink-drive limit '
text: m1 crash driver 'twice drink-drive limit '

documents.title: men charged over b & q knife attack
text: two men have been charged after a man was injured at a b & q store in nottingham .
it happened at about 13:45 yesterday at the store in the riverside retail park , police said .
a 21-year-old , of west bridgford , has been charged with two counts of assault occasioning abh , assault , theft and possessing a knife in a public place .
he was released on bail and is due to appear at nottingham magistrates ' court next month .
a second man , aged 42 , from nottingham , was charged with perverting the course of justice .
he was also bailed and will appear at the same court for a separate hearing next month .
police said one of the men was injured in the attack but could not say which or the extent of his injuries .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: 'oldest ' argos sign store closes
text: what is believed to be the country 's oldest argos sign has finally - after nearly three decades - gone .
nottingham 's broadmarsh store is no more .
retail expert graham soult told me the sign dated back to the 1980s and is confident no other store in the country has a sign that old .
the chain has re-branded its logo twice since this sign was erected .
a sign on the storefront said it is relocating to a nearby sainsbury 's branch .
the supermarket chain bought argos in 2016 .
author: Christian Hewgill
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: city to shine for light night
text: nottingham will be all aglow tonight as the annual light night returns for an 11th time .
here 's how it looked last year
there will be illuminating exhibitions all over the city from 18:00 , with independent traders and food also lining the streets .
look out for `` enchanted water '' along the canal , an interactive dome at the castle , and a puppet carnival parade through sneinton market .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: workers 'missing out on £ 31bn of overtime '
text: workers in the east midlands are missing out on up to £ 31bn of overtime each year , according to the tuc trade union body .
figures from the union show 20 % of employees in the east midlands work an extra seven-and-a-half hours of unpaid overtime a week .
working extra hours means that you get tired .
when an employer looks at somebody who 's working 45 hours a week who 's only contracted for 40 , that 's great for them .
but , in the long-run , they could actually end up with an empty chair simply because that person is burnt out .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: meet the king and queen of croquet
text: nottinghamshire is home to two world champions in croquet - and they 're married to one another .
you might associate croquet with victorian-era lawns and the disney film , alice in wonderland .
but it 's much more than that , according to paddy chapman , who 's fresh from winning the 2018 association croquet world championships in new zealand .
he says it 's a bit like an outdoor version of snooker and much more a battle of wits than you might expect .
his wife , miranda , is the reigning women 's world champion - that competition was last held in 2015 in nottingham .
the pair , who live in beeston , both play for nottingham croquet club in highfields park .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: appeal over chimney repair scam
text: police are investigating after two men were conned out of money by bogus workmen in alvaston .
in both cases , men approached homeowners claiming that work was required on their chimney .
the victims , an 88-year-old and a 73-year-old , handed over cash but work was not carried out .
police said the men were targeted earlier this month at properties on thorndike avenue and baker street .
an appeal for cctv or dash cam footage has been made .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man guilty of attacking girlfriend before her death
text: a man who handed himself in to a police station saying he had killed a young mum has been found guilty of brutally attacking her before she died , police said .
a post-mortem investigation found tara newbold , whose body was found by police in west bridgford in october 2016 , had died from a cocaine overdose .
it also revealed duane ballin , 36 , had probably used a weapon to inflict more than 30 injuries , including five broken ribs and a punctured lung , on his 29-year-old girlfriend .
police said ballin woke up the next morning at his home in alford court to find her dead and , on his way to hand himself in , called an ambulance .
when he was arrested he was found to have cocaine in his system .
he was found guilty of gbh with intent on thursday , following a trial at nottingham crown court .
he will be sentenced in march .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: derbyshire firm gets airport security cash boost
text: airline passengers could soon be able to pass through security scanners without removing their shoes , the department for transport ( dft ) has announced .
it has awarded £ 1.8m of funding to eight projects , including one in derbyshire , to develop more efficient screening technology .
hope-based security screening technologies is working on a step-on shoe-scanner .
the machine will create high-contrast images to be analysed by computers taught to recognise explosives and other threats .
any shoes flagged up for concerns could then undergo a secondary check .
author: Press Association

documents.title: top scorer vydra may miss royals trip
text: derby county boss gary rowett has suggested he may be without matej vydra and david nugent for tomorrow 's game with reading .
the rams are without a win in three , but a win or draw could see them move up to third in the championship .
`` we 've had a bit of illness in the squad , '' rowett told bbc radio derby .
`` matej vydra is suffering and kevin summerfield [ assistant manager ] wo n't make the game .
`` david nugent has a sore back . ''
we 've had a bit of illness in the squad .
matej vydra is suffering and kevin summerfield ( assistant ) wo n't make the game .
david nugent has a sore back '' gary rowett on fitness ahead of reading trip # dcfcfans
we played really well against leeds for big parts of that game , it might be a time for the team to be settled again .
but there 's also areas where you could play the game differently '' gr on reading trip # dcfcfans # dcfc
chris baird plays forward quickly and contributes to chances .
continuity is in the forefront of my mind '' gr on selection .
# dcfcfans # dcfc
all you can do is try to win the next game .
we 've been really positive about that .
i just focus on what we can do '' gr # dcfcfans # dcfc
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : frosty day in the east midlands
text: it was a cold and frosty start to the day across the region , including in the peak district .
weather watcher wendy scott captured it perfectly near stanage .
there were frosty scenes in loughborough too .
and it was chilly in east leake , nottinghamshire .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: owen jones to lead labour campaign day in mansfield
text: prominent labour activist and guardian newspaper columnist owen jones is to lead a day of campaigning in mansfield tomorrow .
ben bradley won the seat for the consevatives at last year 's general election , after 94 years of labour .
mr jones said the day was about `` knocking on doors '' and `` listening to people '' .
the bbc has attempted to contact ben bradley and conservative central office for comment but there has been no reply .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: 'new ' landlords scoop top pub award
text: the smithfield has been named pub of the year by the derby branch of the campaign for real ale ( camra ) .
the award was extra special for emily bowler and her partner ben , as they only started running the pub 12 months ago .
they said they were also advised against becoming landlords by friends and family .
the pub will now go through to the east midlands finals .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: academic wins role to fight sport corruption
text: a legal expert from the university of nottingham has been appointed to a global group fighting corruption in sport .
professor sue arrowsmith 's new role will see her advising the international partnership against corruption in sport .
she will be specifically looking at reducing the risk of corruption in procurement relating to sporting events and infrastructure .
this includes the award of contracts for constructing stadia for olympic games and world cups .
professor arrowsmith , who has competed for wales in the triathlon and played football for wimbledon , is also qualified as an fa referee .
`` the creation of this kind of partnership is long overdue , '' she said .
`` achieving real change will not be easy but i am looking forward to making my own contribution to this challenging work . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: homes evacuated over sus package
text: a number of homes were evacuated in loughborough last night after a sus package was delivered to a property .
leicestershire police were called to herbert street just after midnight .
officers cordoned off the area and a bomb disposal unit was called in to examine the package .
it was later declared safe and residents were allowed to return to their homes .
leicestershire police said : `` investigations are in their early stages and enquiries are being carried out in relation to the incident . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: manor house fails to sell at auction
text: an 18th century house , considered to be one of the finest georgian buildings in derbyshire , has failed to sell at auction .
the homestead , a grade i-listed , nine-bedroom property at spondon , used to be the home of artist joseph wright 's daughter .
the property is still on the market with a price of about £ 640,000 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham 's last marching band 'struggling on '
text: musicians are travelling from yorkshire to keep nottingham 's last competitive marching band going .
there used to be hundreds of traditional marching bands across england in mining communities , but many folded when the pits shut .
the nottingham lionhearts formed four years ago on the bestwood estate .
karen langford , who travels from barnsley to perform , said : `` people have grown up , they 've got jobs , they 've got families and they just ca n't commit . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: weather : a frosty start with some bright spells
text: here 's what the weather has in store for us in the east midlands today .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: star wars toys fetch almost £ 10k at auction
text: an `` amazing '' collection of unopened stars wars toys has sold for almost £ 10,000 at auction .
the toys , many of which were made at palitoy in coalville , had an original auctioneer 's estimate of just £ 2,000-3,000 .
david wilson-turner , from etwall-based auctioneers hansons , said : `` the entire collection eventually sold for £ 9,240 , which was amazing .
`` the popularity of star wars is immense .
we had huge interest in these figures right from the start but this result still exceeded our expectations . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: rise in arson attacks in leicestershire
text: there 's been a rise in the number of arson attacks in leicestershire and rutland , according to police figures .
data obtained by bbc radio leicester shows officers investigated 319 alleged offences last year .
that compares to 271 reported arson attacks across leicestershire and rutland in 2013 .
there are a lot of old factory buildings that have been derelict and these have been set on fire deliberately in many cases .
young people use them as playgrounds and they 're being used by homeless people as shelter . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: kylie announces nottingham gig
text: kylie minogue has announced she will be performing in nottingham later this year as part of a uk and ireland tour .
the australian pop star , who is known for her extravagant visual shows and jaw-dropping stage costumes , will hit the road in september and october .
the 49-year-old 's nottingham gig is scheduled for 20 september .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: royal derby hospital baby deaths 'preventable '
text: a review into the deaths of dozens of babies at the royal derby hospital between 2013 and 2016 has found many of them might have been preventable .
the perinatal institute , which was set up to enhance the safety and quality of maternity care , examined 41 neo-natal deaths and stillbirths .
nineteen of those deaths may have been caused by care failures , the organisation said in its report .
the hospital 's trust has apologised and said it has changed its procedures .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News

documents.title: travel : latest from region 's roads
text: here 's how it is looking on the highways of the east midlands :
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to friday across derbyshire , leicestershire , nottinghamshire and rutland .
dave wade and i will be with you until later with the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News
